html:
** Even as Amazon.com AMZN.O underperformed the broader FAANG group in 2021, short-covering in the ecommerce giant accelerated over the past 30 days, S3 Partners said in a note published on Monday

** Only AMZN is seeing outsized recent short-covering in the group, with almost $4 bln of buy-to-covers over the last 30 days, a 26.5% decrease in shares shorted, S3 data showed

** Meanwhile, short-selling in other online retailers Alibaba Group ADR BABA.N and MercadoLibre Inc MELI.O increased in the same period, which shows AMZN's short-covering is not a sector trend but specific to AMZN - S3

** With the short side thinking less negatively about AMZN's stock price performance, it is not irrational to think that the long side will become more positive concerning AMZN's stock price performance as well, said Ihor Dusaniwsky, managing director of predictive analytics at S3

** "If shorts continue covering and the long side increases buying pressure, we may see a rally in AMZN's stock price in early 2022," Dusaniwsky added

** AMZN ended 2021 2.4% higher, far underperforming the NYSE FANG+ index .NYFANG, an equal-weighted group of 10 such stocks, which jumped 17%


(Reporting by Medha Singh)

(( medha.singh@thomsonreuters.com ))
